boone

Class PatternSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.PatternSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpikeSet

    public class PatternSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Base class that defines a generic data structure for the storage of network related data. The actual usage and semantics of the stored data have to be defined by extending this base class. The stored data is grouped in four different categories, represented by four different lists:

    1. A List that holds pattern names
    2. A List that holds input patterns
    3. A List that holds target patterns
    4. A List that holds output patterns

    This class provides access to the lists and methods to load and store the DataSet to/from XML.

    Version:
    $Id: DataSet.java 2271 2015-03-22 jmory $
    Author:
    Helmut A. Mayer, Johannes Mory

    • Field Detail

      • names

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> names
        The optional pattern names ordered accordingly. If a pattern has no name, it gets the default name '#', where '#' is the index of the pattern.

      • getInputPatternSize

        public int getInputPatternSize()
        Return the number of values for each input pattern. Use this method only if all input patterns have the same number of values.

      • getTargetPatternSize

        public int getTargetPatternSize()
        Return the number of values for each target pattern. Use this method only if all target patterns have the same number of values.

      • getOutputPatternSize

        public int getOutputPatternSize()
        Return the number of values for each output pattern. Use this method only if all output patterns have the same number of values.

      • load

        public static PatternSet load(java.io.File file,
                              IOFilter filter)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a DataSet from the given file using the set file filter. If loading is successful, the given filter is attached to the set. Do not forget to configure the filter for the correct state of compression of the file to be loaded.
        Parameters:
        file - file to load the data set from
        Returns:
        a data set, null if problems
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • save

          throws java.io.IOException
        Save the data set to a file with the specified name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • join

        public void join(PatternSet other)
        Joins a data set to this data set. The other data set is appended to this data set. Also copies those properties from the other set, whose keys are strings being different from the string keys in this data set.
        Parameters:
        other - another data set

      • subSet

        public PatternSet subSet(int first,
                         int last)
        Returns a subset of this data set. The subset is a deep copy including the properties. If the number of input patterns does not allow a proper subset, null is returned. If targets, outputs or names cannot be split into a subset, e.g., there are no names, the returned data set has an empty list for the corresponding category.
        Parameters:
        first - the first pattern (included in the subset)
        last - the last pattern (excluded from the subset)
        Returns:
        the subset, null if too few input patterns

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Reorders the patterns in this set randomly.

      • swap

        public void swap(int pos1,
                 int pos2)
        Swaps the two patterns at position pos1 and pos2 including names, inputs, targets, and outputs.
        Parameters:
        pos1 - the first position
        pos2 - the second position

      • normalizeInputs

        public void normalizeInputs()
        Normalizes the input patterns using the euclidean norm, so all input vectors are changed to unit vectors.

      • writeValues

        public java.lang.StringBuffer writeValues(char separator,
                                          boolean names,
                                          boolean split)
        Writes a pattern set into a string buffer.
        Parameters:
        separator - the character separating values
        names - if true, pattern names are added as single line comments (starting with '#')
        split - if true, input values and target values appear on separate lines
        Returns:
        the patterns as string buffer

      • mapToInterval

        public void mapToInterval(double low,
                          double high)
        Maps all input and target values to the given interval. The minimal value of an input/target feature in the set will be mapped to 'low. The maximal value of an input/target feature will be mapped to 'high'.
        Parameters:
        low - the lower interval boundary
        high - the higher interval boundary

      • mapInputsToInterval

        public void mapInputsToInterval(double low,
                                double high)
        Maps all input values to the given interval. The minimal value of an input in the set will be mapped to 'low. The maximal value of an input will be mapped to 'high'. Improve by saving the original min/max values into props.
        Parameters:
        low - the lower interval boundary
        high - the higher interval boundary

      • mapTargetsToInterval

        public void mapTargetsToInterval(double low,
                                 double high)
        Maps all target values to the given interval. The minimal value of a target in the set will be mapped to 'low. The maximal value of a target will be mapped to 'high'.
        Parameters:
        low - the lower interval boundary
        high - the higher interval boundary
